page.title: 12A Farm Visit
page.content: Stuart Baird from Green Park Primary School visited Highway Farm Lydiate with the rest of his class. "When we went to Highway Farm we got a bit lost but when we got there i asked a few questions.Mr Harrison,the farmer told me that the farm was about 200 years old.He said that there were some interesting out buildings,some as old as the farm,they had no windows and were used for milking cows. The farmer mostly grew crops but they also had 2 cows and 2 dogs.The 2 cows are beef cattle which means they give meat.When we walked round the farm we saw potatoes,barley,cabbages and cauliflower growing.The main enemy to the crop is the Colorado beetle which eats and puts disease on the potatoes. After I had been to the farm I went home."
